body.p:
Jeffersonville, Indiana
January 27" 1865
Govenor Thos E. Bramlette
Sir,

I received to day the recommendation herewith transmitted. This recommendation was kindly furnished me without soliciation on my part, which coming from the distinguished source it does, is rendered doubly valuable to me. The position refered to in the Petition has been filled by your Excellency, and the sellection of Major Frederick Slates, was an excellent one. He is not only a perfect Gentleman but a gallant and honerable Officer.

I however forward the recommendation to your Excellency, and if a position of a higher rank than the one I now occupy should become vacant, and you deem me worthy. I should be pleased to have the Petition recognized by my appointment thereto.

I am Govenor
Very Respectfully
Your Obt Sv't
Edward H. Green

Jeffersonville Ind.
Jany. 27" 1865
Green Edward H.
To the Gov-

Says the position refered to in the enclosed peitition has been filled, but asks that you will consider the petition, if a position of a higher rank than the one he now occupies, should become vacant-
Recd A. G. O. Ky 30 Jany 1865
